intro: Agathosma ciliata, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, small, pink or white flowers. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine cilia, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Agathosma ciliata is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
